instructions:
Remove skin and fat from chicken and dust with flour.
Fry to a dark golden brown *(about 15 minutes)* in olive oil in a frying pan that has a lid. Remove chicken and
discard all but about 1 tbsp of fat. Combine 1 clove of crushed garlic, capers, lemon juice, chicken broth, red
pepper, 1 tsp rosemary and deglaze the pan with this mixture. Return chicken to pan, bring to a boil and
simmer uncovered for about 10 minutes or until liquid is reduced by about 1/3. Cover and simmer for an
additional 25 minutes. If necessary, add water to make about 1/2 cup of sauce.
Make a paste of remaining 2 cloves of crushed garlic, anchovies, remaining 1 tsp rosemary, oregano,
marjoram and thin with vinegar. Add and mix with sauce in pan and simmer chicken in covered pan for an
additional 5 minutes. Serve with sauce from frying pan.
ingredients: 2 1/2 to 3 lb chicken, cut up (or 6 thighs)
name: Roman Chicken
